title: Virtual Reality Software Engineer
description: Constructing a virtual environment in the Unreal to create the first course on campus with primary instruction in virtual reality. Utilizing Unreal and C#, the course in constructed in conjunction with students from the education department and with several developers to make a realistic and interactive digital environment to teach archaeological methods. Contributions thus far include the construction of a full prototype, interactive, voxel-desctructable soil, several archaeological tools and full interaction, and game mechanics.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
company: Beckman Institute for Advanced Science and Technology
description: Followed every stage of the standard development cycle on the Beckman Research Institute website utilizing ASP.NET web forms/MVC. Expanded the Tech Talks Events page to include dynamic content from the YouTube API with JQuery and refactoring stylesheets to prepare for a future migration to a new theme template. Created a digital signage widget utilizing KnockoutJS and SignalR to display dynamic, real-time data to various endpoints from the API. Implemented a new mobile-friendly and modern theme for the new home site on SiteFinity.

title: Front End Web Developer
description: Contributed to the backend and frontend creation of a new application for the Morningstar website. Utilizing Kotlin for the backend API development I was responsible for creating tests against various endpoints. The frontend development was done in Vue.js and I was responsible for the creation of several core functions to the application, as well as creating testing strategies for routing, component loading, and schematic mocking on JSON responses.
